questions.question_text: A company deployed the Cisco Webex App with single sign-on enabled using the internal IdP, but users receive the error "Single Sign On Failed. Invalid Status code in Resume" when trying to log in through the security assertion markup language SSO. Which action must an administrator take to resolve the issue?

choices.D: Configure SSO in Control Hub ADFS.
choices.B: Configure SSO in Control Hub with Microsoft Azure.
choices.A: Configure SSO in Control Hub with Cisco DUO.
choices.C: Configure SSO in Control Hub with Okta.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct option depends on the specific Identity Provider that the company is using for Single Sign-On. The error message suggests that there may be a misconfiguration or mismatch in the SAML response, so the administrator must ensure that the correct IdP configuration is set up in the Webex Control Hub.

If the company uses Microsoft Azure, Option B is correct.
If the company uses Okta, Option C is correct.
If the company uses ADFS, Option D is correct.
Since the problem is related to an internal IdP, Option D: Configure SSO in Control Hub with ADFS is the most likely correct action

Selected Answer: D
Cisco supports all of these SSO providers as well as SSO with multiple Idp- so technically everyone one of these would be a solution, right?
That beeing said, DUO, Okta and Azure are Cloud Solutions therefore I think they are looking for Option D - ADFS

questions.question_text: Using SAML 2.0 in Cisco Collaboration delegates the authentication of Cisco administrative users to which party?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"Service providers are no longer involved in authentication. SAML 2.0 delegates authentication away from the service providers and to the IdPs."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/SAML_SSO_deployment_guide/15/cucm_b_saml-sso-deployment-guide-release-15.pdf

questions.question_text: A collaboration engineer is enabling interdomain federation for Cisco IM and Presence. The engineer has been asked to enable federation with Office 365. Which service must the engineer enable to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"Turn on the Cisco XCP SIP Federation Connection Manager service. This turns on the SIP Federation feature for each user that you provision. You must complete this task on each node in the cluster."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/interdomain_federation/14/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-guide-14/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-1251su3_chapter_0111.html

choices.C: Cisco XCP SIP Federation Connection Manager
choices.A: Cisco XCP XMPP Federation Connection Manager

questions.question_text: A collaboration engineer is implementing the Apple Push Notification service for Jabber clients running on iOS and has saved the configuration in Cisco UCM under Advanced Features > Cisco Cloud Onboarding. What is the next step to install Cisco-managed certificates?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer should be C:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/push_notifications/cucm_b_push-notifications-deployment-guide/cucm_b_push-notifications-deployment-guide_chapter_01.html

choices.D: Restart the Cisco UCM Push Notification service.
choices.C: Restart the Cisco Tomcat service on all nodes in the Cisco UCM cluster.
choices.B: Restart the Cisco Tomcat service on all nodes in the IM and Presence cluster.
choices.A: Restart the Cisco XCP router service on IM and Presence.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
As the forwarding user has a mailbox , it will go to Attemp Forward rule.

Selected Answer: C
i think C is correct

questions.question_text: A collaboration engineer is configuring a Cisco Unity Connection system that is integrated with Cisco UCM via SIP. The engineer wants to modify the default behavior for calls that arrive at Unity Connection after first being presented to an existing Unity Connection user's extension. Which call routing rule must the engineer modify to accomplish this modification?
